 17 
 18 /**
 19  * Sets up base image functionality.
 20  * 
 21  * @param {bigshot.ImageParameters} parameters the image parameters
 22  * @class Base class for image viewers.
 23  * @extends bigshot.EventDispatcher
 24  */     
 25 bigshot.ImageBase = function (parameters) {
 26     // Base class init
 27     bigshot.EventDispatcher.call (this);
 28     
 29     this.parameters = parameters;
 30     this.flying = 0;
 31     this.container = parameters.container;
 32     this.x = parameters.width / 2.0;
 33     this.y = parameters.height / 2.0;
 34     this.zoom = 0.0;
 35     this.width = parameters.width;
 36     this.height = parameters.height;
 37     this.minZoom = parameters.minZoom;
 38     this.maxZoom = parameters.maxZoom;
 39     this.tileSize = parameters.tileSize;
 40     this.overlap = 0;
 41     this.imageTileCache = null;
 42     
 43     this.dragStart = null;
 44     this.dragged = false;
 45     
 46     this.layers = new Array ();
 47     
 48     this.fullScreenHandler = null;
 49     this.currentGesture = null;
 50     
 51     var that = this;
 52     this.onresizeHandler = function (e) {
 53         that.onresize ();
 54     }
 55     
 56     /**
 57      * Helper function to consume events.
 58      * @private
 59      */
 60     var consumeEvent = function (event) {
 61         if (event.preventDefault) {
 62             event.preventDefault ();
 63         }
 64         return false;
 65     };
 66     
 67     /**
 68      * Helper function to translate touch events to mouse-like events.
 69      * @private
 70      */
 71     var translateEvent = function (event) {
 72         if (event.clientX) {
 73             return event;
 74         } else {
 75             return {
 76                 clientX : event.changedTouches[0].clientX,
 77                 clientY : event.changedTouches[0].clientY,
 78                 changedTouches : event.changedTouches
 79             };
 80         };
 81     };
 82     
 83     this.setupLayers ();
 84     
 85     this.resize ();
 86     
 87     this.allListeners = {
 88         "DOMMouseScroll" : function (e) {
 89             that.mouseWheel (e);
 90             return consumeEvent (e);
 91         },
 92         "mousewheel" : function (e) {
 93             that.mouseWheel (e);
 94             return consumeEvent (e);
 95         },
 96         "dblclick" : function (e) {
 97             that.mouseDoubleClick (e);
 98             return consumeEvent (e);
 99         },
100         "mousedown" : function (e) {
101             that.dragMouseDown (e);
102             return consumeEvent (e);
103         },
104         "gesturestart" : function (e) {
105             that.gestureStart (e);
106             return consumeEvent (e);
107         },
108         "gesturechange" : function (e) {
109             that.gestureChange (e);
110             return consumeEvent (e);
111         },
112         "gestureend" : function (e) {
113             that.gestureEnd (e);
114             return consumeEvent (e);
115         },
116         "touchstart" : function (e) {
117             that.dragMouseDown (translateEvent (e));
118             return consumeEvent (e);
119         },
120         "mouseup" : function (e) {
121             that.dragMouseUp (e);
122             return consumeEvent (e);
123         },
124         "touchend" : function (e) {
125             that.dragMouseUp (translateEvent (e));
126             return consumeEvent (e);
127         },
128         "mousemove" : function (e) {
129             that.dragMouseMove (e);
130             return consumeEvent (e);
131         },
132         "mouseout" : function (e) {
133             //that.dragMouseUp (e);
134             return consumeEvent (e);
135         },
136         "touchmove" : function (e) {
137             that.dragMouseMove (translateEvent (e));
138             return consumeEvent (e);
139         }
140     };
141     
142     this.addEventListeners ();
143     this.browser.registerListener (window, 'resize', that.onresizeHandler, false);
144     this.zoomToFit ();
145 }    
146 
147 bigshot.ImageBase.prototype = {
148     /**
149      * Browser helper and compatibility functions.
150      *
151      * @private
152      * @type bigshot.Browser
153      */
154     browser : new bigshot.Browser (),
155     
156     /**
157      * Adds all event listeners to the container object.
158      * @private
159      */
160     addEventListeners : function () {
161         for (var k in this.allListeners) {
162             this.browser.registerListener (this.container, k, this.allListeners[k], false);
163         }
164     },
165     
166     /**
167      * Removes all event listeners from the container object.
168      * @private
169      */
170     removeEventListeners : function () {
171         for (var k in this.allListeners) {
172             this.browser.unregisterListener (this.container, k, this.allListeners[k], false);
173         }
174     },
175     
176     /**
177      * Sets up the initial layers of the image. Override in subclass.
178      */
179     setupLayers : function () {
180     },
181     
182     /**
183      * Returns the base 2 logarithm of the maximum texture stretching, allowing for device pixel scaling.
184      * @type number
185      * @private
186      */
187     getTextureStretch : function () {
188         var ts = Math.log (this.parameters.maxTextureMagnification / this.browser.getDevicePixelScale ()) / Math.LN2;
189         return ts;
190     },
191     
192     /**
193      * Constrains the x and y coordinates to allowed values
194      * @param {number} x the initial x coordinate
195      * @param {number} y the initial y coordinate
196      * @return {number} .x the constrained x coordinate
197      * @return {number} .y the constrained y coordinate
198      */
199     clampXY : function (x, y) {
200         var viewportWidth = this.container.clientWidth;
201         var viewportHeight = this.container.clientHeight;
202         
203         var realZoomFactor = Math.pow (2, this.zoom);
204         /*
205         Constrain X and Y
206         */
207         var viewportWidthInImagePixels = viewportWidth / realZoomFactor;
208         var viewportHeightInImagePixels = viewportHeight / realZoomFactor;
209         
210         var constrain = function (viewportSizeInImagePixels, imageSizeInImagePixels, p) {
211             var min = viewportSizeInImagePixels / 2;
212             min = Math.min (imageSizeInImagePixels / 2, min);
213             if (p < min) {
214                 p = min;
215             }
216             
217             var max = imageSizeInImagePixels - viewportSizeInImagePixels / 2;
218             max = Math.max (imageSizeInImagePixels / 2, max);
219             if (p > max) {
220                 p = max;
221             }
222             return p;
223         };
224         
225         var o = {};
226         if (x != null) {
227             o.x = constrain (viewportWidthInImagePixels, this.width, x);
228         }
229         
230         if (y != null) {
231             o.y = constrain (viewportHeightInImagePixels, this.height, y);
232         }
233         
234         return o;
235     },
236     
237     /**
238      * Lays out all layers according to the current 
239      * x, y and zoom values.
240      *
241      * @public
242      */
243     layout : function () {
244         var viewportWidth = this.container.clientWidth;
245         var viewportHeight = this.container.clientHeight;
246         
247         var zoomWithStretch = Math.min (this.maxZoom, Math.max (this.zoom - this.getTextureStretch (), this.minZoom));
248         
249         var zoomLevel = Math.min (0, Math.ceil (zoomWithStretch));
250         var zoomFactor = Math.pow (2, zoomLevel);
251         
252         var clamped = this.clampXY (this.x, this.y);
253         
254         if (!this.parameters.wrapY) {
255             this.y = clamped.y;
256         }
257         
258         if (!this.parameters.wrapX) {
259             this.x = clamped.x;
260         }
261         
262         var tileWidthInRealPixels = this.tileSize / zoomFactor;
263         
264         var fractionalZoomFactor = Math.pow (2, this.zoom - zoomLevel);
265         var tileDisplayWidth = this.tileSize * fractionalZoomFactor;
266         
267         var widthInTiles = this.width / tileWidthInRealPixels;
268         var heightInTiles = this.height / tileWidthInRealPixels;
269         var centerInTilesX = this.x / tileWidthInRealPixels;
270         var centerInTilesY = this.y / tileWidthInRealPixels;
271         
272         var topLeftInTilesX = centerInTilesX - (viewportWidth / 2) / tileDisplayWidth;
273         var topLeftInTilesY = centerInTilesY - (viewportHeight / 2) / tileDisplayWidth;
274         
275         var topLeftTileX = Math.floor (topLeftInTilesX);
276         var topLeftTileY = Math.floor (topLeftInTilesY);
277         var topLeftTileXoffset = Math.round ((topLeftInTilesX - topLeftTileX) * tileDisplayWidth);
278         var topLeftTileYoffset = Math.round ((topLeftInTilesY - topLeftTileY) * tileDisplayWidth);
279         
280         for (var i = 0; i < this.layers.length; ++i) {
281             this.layers[i].layout (
282                 zoomWithStretch, 
283                 -topLeftTileXoffset - tileDisplayWidth, -topLeftTileYoffset - tileDisplayWidth, 
284                 topLeftTileX - 1, topLeftTileY - 1, 
285                 Math.ceil (tileDisplayWidth), Math.ceil (tileDisplayWidth), 
286                 1.0);
287         }
288     },
289     
290     /**
291      * Resizes the layers of this image.
292      *
293      * @public
294      */
295     resize : function () {
296         var tilesW = Math.ceil (2 * this.container.clientWidth / this.tileSize) + 2;
297         var tilesH = Math.ceil (2 * this.container.clientHeight / this.tileSize) + 2;
298         for (var i = 0; i < this.layers.length; ++i) {
299             this.layers[i].resize (tilesW, tilesH);
300         }
301     },
302     
303     /**
304      * Creates a HTML div container for a layer. This method
305      * is called by the layer's constructor to obtain a 
306      * container.
307      *
308      * @public
309      * @type HTMLDivElement
310      */
311     createLayerContainer : function () {
312         var layerContainer = document.createElement ("div");
313         layerContainer.style.position = "absolute";
314         layerContainer.style.overflow = "hidden";
315         return layerContainer;
316     },
317     
318     /**
319      * Returns the div element used as viewport.
320      *
321      * @public
322      * @type HTMLDivElement
323      */
324     getContainer : function () {
325         return this.container;
326     },
327     
328     /**
329      * Adds a new layer to the image.
330      *
331      * @public
332      * @see bigshot.HotspotLayer for usage example
333      * @param {bigshot.Layer} layer the layer to add.
334      */
335     addLayer : function (layer) {
336         this.container.appendChild (layer.getContainer ());
337         this.layers.push (layer);
338     },
339     
340     /**
341      * Clamps the zoom value to be between minZoom and maxZoom.
342      *
343      * @param {number} zoom the zoom value
344      * @type number
345      */
346     clampZoom : function (zoom) {
347         return Math.min (this.maxZoom, Math.max (zoom, this.minZoom));
348     },
349     
350     /**
351      * Sets the current zoom value.
352      *
353      * @private
354      * @param {number} zoom the zoom value.
355      * @param {boolean} [layout] trigger a viewport update after setting. Defaults to <code>false</code>.
356      */
357     setZoom : function (zoom, updateViewport) {
358         this.zoom = this.clampZoom (zoom);
359         var zoomLevel = Math.ceil (this.zoom - this.getTextureStretch ());
360         var zoomFactor = Math.pow (2, zoomLevel);
361         var maxTileX = Math.ceil (zoomFactor * this.width / this.tileSize);
362         var maxTileY = Math.ceil (zoomFactor * this.height / this.tileSize);
363         for (var i = 0; i < this.layers.length; ++i) {
364             this.layers[i].setMaxTiles (maxTileX, maxTileY);
365         }
366         if (updateViewport) {
367             this.layout ();
368         }
369     },
370     
371     /**
372      * Sets the maximum zoom value. The maximum magnification (of the full-size image)
373      * is 2<sup>maxZoom</sup>. Set to 0.0 to avoid pixelation.
374      *
375      * @public
376      * @param {number} maxZoom the maximum zoom value
377      */
378     setMaxZoom : function (maxZoom) {
379         this.maxZoom = maxZoom;
380     },
381     
382     /**
383      * Gets the maximum zoom value. The maximum magnification (of the full-size image)
384      * is 2<sup>maxZoom</sup>.
385      * 
386      * @public
387      * @type number
388      */
389     getMaxZoom : function () {
390         return this.maxZoom;
391     },
392     
393     /**
394      * Sets the minimum zoom value. The minimum magnification (of the full-size image)
395      * is 2<sup>minZoom</sup>, so a minZoom of <code>-3</code> means that the smallest
396      * image shown will be one-eighth of the full-size image.
397      *
398      * @public
399      * @param {number} minZoom the minimum zoom value for this image
400      */
401     setMinZoom : function (minZoom) {
402         this.minZoom = minZoom;
403     },
404     
405     /**
406      * Gets the minimum zoom value. The minimum magnification (of the full-size image)
407      * is 2<sup>minZoom</sup>, so a minZoom of <code>-3</code> means that the smallest
408      * image shown will be one-eighth of the full-size image.
409      * 
410      * @public
411      * @type number
412      */
413     getMinZoom : function () {
414         return this.minZoom;
415     },
416     
417     /**
418      * Adjusts a coordinate so that the center of zoom
419      * remains constant during zooming operations. The
420      * method is intended to be called twice, once for x 
421      * and once for y. The <code>current</code> and 
422      * <code>centerOfZoom</code> values will be the current
423      * and the center for the x and y, respectively.
424      *
425      * @example
426      * this.x = this.adjustCoordinateForZoom (this.x, zoomCenterX, oldZoom, newZoom);
427      * this.y = this.adjustCoordinateForZoom (this.y, zoomCenterY, oldZoom, newZoom);
428      *
429      * @param {number} current the current value of the coordinate
430      * @param {number} centerOfZoom the center of zoom along the coordinate axis
431      * @param {number} oldZoom the old zoom value
432      * @param {number} oldZoom the new zoom value 
433      * @type number
434      * @returns the new value for the coordinate
435      */
436     adjustCoordinateForZoom : function (current, centerOfZoom, oldZoom, newZoom) {
437         var zoomRatio = Math.pow (2, oldZoom) / Math.pow (2, newZoom);
438         return centerOfZoom + (current - centerOfZoom) * zoomRatio;
439     },
440     
441     /**
442      * Begins a potential drag event.
443      *
444      * @private
445      */
446     gestureStart : function (event) {
447         this.currentGesture = {
448             startZoom : this.zoom,
449             scale : event.scale
450         };            
451     },
452     
453     /**
454      * Ends a gesture.
455      *
456      * @param {Event} event the <code>gestureend</code> event
457      * @private
458      */
459     gestureEnd : function (event) {
460         this.currentGesture = null;
461         if (this.dragStart) {
462             this.dragStart.hadGesture = true;
463         }
464     },
465     
466     /**
467      * Adjusts the zoom level based on the scale property of the
468      * gesture.
469      *
470      * @private
471      */
472     gestureChange : function (event) {
473         if (this.currentGesture) {
474             if (this.dragStart) {
475                 this.dragStart.hadGesture = true;
476             }
477             
478             var newZoom = this.clampZoom (this.currentGesture.startZoom + Math.log (event.scale) / Math.log (2));
479             var oldZoom = this.getZoom ();
480             if (this.currentGesture.clientX !== undefined && this.currentGesture.clientY !== undefined) {
481                 var centerOfZoom = this.clientToImage (this.currentGesture.clientX, this.currentGesture.clientY);
482                 
483                 var nx = this.adjustCoordinateForZoom (this.x, centerOfZoom.x, oldZoom, newZoom);
484                 var ny = this.adjustCoordinateForZoom (this.y, centerOfZoom.y, oldZoom, newZoom);
485                 
486                 this.moveTo (nx, ny, newZoom);
487             } else {
488                 this.setZoom (newZoom);
489                 this.layout ();
490             }
491         }
492     },
493     
494     /**
495      * Begins a potential drag event.
496      *
497      * @private
498      */
499     dragMouseDown : function (event) {
500         this.dragStart = {
501             x : event.clientX,
502             y : event.clientY
503         };
504         this.dragLast = {
505             clientX : event.clientX,
506             clientY : event.clientY,
507             dx : 0,
508             dy : 0,
509             dt : 1000000,
510             time : new Date ().getTime ()
511         };
512         this.dragged = false;
513     },
514     
515     /**
516      * Handles a mouse drag event by panning the image.
517      * Also sets the dragged flag to indicate that the
518      * following <code>click</code> event should be ignored.
519      * @private
520      */
521     dragMouseMove : function (event) {
522         if (this.currentGesture != null && event.changedTouches != null && event.changedTouches.length > 0) {
523             var cx = 0;
524             var cy = 0;
525             for (var i = 0; i < event.changedTouches.length; ++i) {
526                 cx += event.changedTouches[i].clientX;
527                 cy += event.changedTouches[i].clientY;
528             }
529             this.currentGesture.clientX = cx / event.changedTouches.length;
530             this.currentGesture.clientY = cy / event.changedTouches.length;
531         }        
532         
533         if (this.currentGesture == null && this.dragStart != null) {
534             var delta = {
535                 x : event.clientX - this.dragStart.x,
536                 y : event.clientY - this.dragStart.y
537             };
538             if (delta.x != 0 || delta.y != 0) {
539                 this.dragged = true;
540             }
541             var zoomFactor = Math.pow (2, this.zoom);
542             var realX = delta.x / zoomFactor;
543             var realY = delta.y / zoomFactor;
544             
545             this.dragStart = {
546                 x : event.clientX,
547                 y : event.clientY
548             };
549             
550             var dt = new Date ().getTime () - this.dragLast.time;
551             if (dt > 20) {
552                 this.dragLast = {
553                     dx : this.dragLast.clientX - event.clientX,
554                     dy : this.dragLast.clientY - event.clientY,
555                     dt : dt,
556                     clientX : event.clientX,
557                     clientY : event.clientY,
558                     time : new Date ().getTime ()
559                 };
560             }
561             
562             this.moveTo (this.x - realX, this.y - realY);
563         }
564     },
565     
566     /**
567      * Ends a drag event by freeing the associated structures.
568      * @private
569      */
570     dragMouseUp : function (event) {
571         if (this.currentGesture == null && !this.dragStart.hadGesture && this.dragStart != null) {
572             this.dragStart = null;
573             if (!this.dragged) {
574                 this.mouseClick (event);
575             } else {
576                 var scale = Math.pow (2, this.zoom);
577                 var dx = this.dragLast.dx / scale;
578                 var dy = this.dragLast.dy / scale;
579                 var ds = Math.sqrt (dx * dx + dy * dy);
580                 var dt = this.dragLast.dt;
581                 var dtb = new Date ().getTime () - this.dragLast.time;
582                 this.dragLast = null;
583                 
584                 var v = dt > 0 ? (ds / dt) : 0;
585                 if (v > 0.05 && dtb < 250 && dt > 20 && this.parameters.fling) {
586                     var t0 = new Date ().getTime ();
587                     
588                     dx /= dt;
589                     dy /= dt;
590                     
591                     this.flyTo (this.x + dx * 250, this.y + dy * 250, this.zoom);
592                 }   
593             }
594         }
595     },
596     
597     /**
598      * Mouse double-click handler. Pans to the clicked point and
599      * zooms in half a zoom level (approx 40%).
600      * @private
601      */
602     mouseDoubleClick : function (event) {
603         var eventData = this.createImageEventData ({
604                 type : "dblclick",
605                 clientX : event.clientX,
606                 clientY : event.clientY
607             });
608         this.fireEvent ("dblclick", eventData);
609         if (!eventData.defaultPrevented) {
610             this.flyTo (eventData.imageX, eventData.imageY, this.zoom + 0.5);
611         }
612     },
613     
614     /**
615      * Returns the current zoom level.
616      *
617      * @public
618      * @type number
619      */
620     getZoom : function () {
621         return this.zoom;
622     },
623     
624     /**
625      * Stops any current flyTo operation and sets the current position.
626      *
627      * @param [x] the new x-coordinate
628      * @param [y] the new y-coordinate
629      * @param [zoom] the new zoom level
630      * @param [updateViewport=true] updates the viewport
631      * @public
632      */
633     moveTo : function (x, y, zoom, updateViewport) {
634         this.stopFlying ();
635         
636         if (x != null || y != null) {
637             this.setPosition (x, y, false);
638         }
639         if (zoom != null) {
640             this.setZoom (zoom, false);
641         }
642         if (updateViewport == undefined || updateViewport == true) {
643             this.layout ();
644         }
645     },
646     
647     /**
648      * Sets the current position.
649      *
650      * @param [x] the new x-coordinate
651      * @param [y] the new y-coordinate
652      * @param [updateViewport=true] if the viewport should be updated
653      * @private
654      */
655     setPosition : function (x, y, updateViewport) {
656         var clamped = this.clampXY (x, y);
657         
658         if (x != null) {
659             if (this.parameters.wrapX) {
660                 if (x < 0 || x >= this.width) {
661                     x = (x + this.width) % this.width;
662                 }
663             } else {
664                 x = clamped.x;
665             }
666             this.x = Math.max (0, Math.min (this.width, x));
667         }
668         
669         if (y != null) {
670             if (this.parameters.wrapY) {
671                 if (y < 0 || y >= this.height) {
672                     y = (y + this.height) % this.height;
673                 }
674             } else {
675                 y = clamped.y;
676             }
677             this.y = Math.max (0, Math.min (this.height, y));
678         }
679         
680         if (updateViewport != false) {
681             this.layout ();
682         }
683     },
684     
685     /**
686      * Helper function for calculating zoom levels.
687      *
688      * @public
689      * @returns the zoom level at which the given number of full-image pixels
690      * occupy the given number of screen pixels.
691      * @param {number} imageDimension the image dimension in full-image pixels
692      * @param {number} containerDimension the container dimension in screen pixels
693      * @type number
694      */
695     fitZoom : function (imageDimension, containerDimension) {
696         var scale = containerDimension / imageDimension;
697         return Math.log (scale) / Math.LN2;
698     },
699     
700     /**
701      * Returns the maximum zoom level at which the full image
702      * is visible in the viewport.
703      * @public
704      * @type number
705      */
706     getZoomToFitValue : function () {
707         return Math.min (
708             this.fitZoom (this.parameters.width, this.container.clientWidth),
709             this.fitZoom (this.parameters.height, this.container.clientHeight));
710     },
711     
712     /**
713      * Returns the zoom level at which the image fills the whole
714      * viewport.
715      * @public
716      * @type number
717      */
718     getZoomToFillValue : function () {
719         return Math.max (
720             this.fitZoom (this.parameters.width, this.container.clientWidth),
721             this.fitZoom (this.parameters.height, this.container.clientHeight));
722     },
723     
724     /**
725      * Adjust the zoom level to fit the image in the viewport.
726      * @public
727      */
728     zoomToFit : function () {
729         this.moveTo (null, null, this.getZoomToFitValue ());
730     },
731     
732     /**
733      * Adjust the zoom level to fit the image in the viewport.
734      * @public
735      */
736     zoomToFill : function () {
737         this.moveTo (null, null, this.getZoomToFillValue ());
738     },
739     
740     /**
741      * Adjust the zoom level to fit the 
742      * image height in the viewport.
743      * @public
744      */
745     zoomToFitHeight : function () {
746         this.moveTo (null, null, this.fitZoom (this.parameters.height, this.container.clientHeight));
747     },
748     
749     /**
750      * Adjust the zoom level to fit the 
751      * image width in the viewport.
752      * @public
753      */
754     zoomToFitWidth : function () {
755         this.moveTo (null, null, this.fitZoom (this.parameters.width, this.container.clientWidth));
756     },
757     
758     /**
759      * Smoothly adjust the zoom level to fit the 
760      * image height in the viewport.
761      * @public
762      */
763     flyZoomToFitHeight : function () {
764         this.flyTo (null, this.parameters.height / 2, this.fitZoom (this.parameters.height, this.container.clientHeight));
765     },
766     
767     /**
768      * Smoothly adjust the zoom level to fit the 
769      * image width in the viewport.
770      * @public
771      */
772     flyZoomToFitWidth : function () {
773         this.flyTo (this.parameters.width / 2, null, this.fitZoom (this.parameters.width, this.container.clientWidth));
774     },
775     
776     /**
777      * Smoothly adjust the zoom level to fit the 
778      * full image in the viewport.
779      * @public
780      */
781     flyZoomToFit : function () {
782         this.flyTo (this.parameters.width / 2, this.parameters.height / 2, this.getZoomToFitValue ());
783     },
784     
785     /**
786      * Converts client-relative screen coordinates to image coordinates.
787      *
788      * @param {number} clientX the client x-coordinate
789      * @param {number} clientY the client y-coordinate
790      *
791      * @returns {number} .x the image x-coordinate
792      * @returns {number} .y the image y-coordinate
793      * @type Object
794      */
795     clientToImage : function (clientX, clientY) {
796         var zoomFactor = Math.pow (2, this.zoom);
797         return {
798             x : (clientX - this.container.clientWidth / 2) / zoomFactor + this.x,
799             y : (clientY - this.container.clientHeight / 2) / zoomFactor + this.y
800         };
801     },
802     
803     /**
804      * Handles mouse wheel actions.
805      * @private
806      */
807     mouseWheelHandler : function (delta, event) {
808         var zoomDelta = false;
809         if (delta > 0) {
810             zoomDelta = 0.5;
811         } else if (delta < 0) {
812             zoomDelta = -0.5;
813         }
814         
815         if (zoomDelta) {
816             var centerOfZoom = this.clientToImage (event.clientX, event.clientY);
817             var newZoom = Math.min (this.maxZoom, Math.max (this.getZoom () + zoomDelta, this.minZoom));
818             
819             var nx = this.adjustCoordinateForZoom (this.x, centerOfZoom.x, this.getZoom (), newZoom);
820             var ny = this.adjustCoordinateForZoom (this.y, centerOfZoom.y, this.getZoom (), newZoom);
821             
822             this.flyTo (nx, ny, newZoom, true);
823         }
824     },
825     
826     /**
827      * Translates mouse wheel events.
828      * @private
829      */
830     mouseWheel : function (event){
831         var delta = 0;
832         if (!event) /* For IE. */
833             event = window.event;
834         if (event.wheelDelta) { /* IE/Opera. */
835             delta = event.wheelDelta / 120;
836             /*
837              * In Opera 9, delta differs in sign as compared to IE.
838              */
839             if (window.opera)
840                 delta = -delta;
841         } else if (event.detail) { /* Mozilla case. */
842             /*
843              * In Mozilla, sign of delta is different than in IE.
844              * Also, delta is multiple of 3.
845              */
846             delta = -event.detail;
847         }
848         
849         /*
850          * If delta is nonzero, handle it.
851          * Basically, delta is now positive if wheel was scrolled up,
852          * and negative, if wheel was scrolled down.
853          */
854         if (delta) {
855             this.mouseWheelHandler (delta, event);
856         }
857         
858         /*
859          * Prevent default actions caused by mouse wheel.
860          * That might be ugly, but we handle scrolls somehow
861          * anyway, so don't bother here..
862          */
863         if (event.preventDefault) {
864             event.preventDefault ();
865         }
866         event.returnValue = false;
867     },
868     
869     /**
870      * Triggers a right-sizing of all layers.
871      * Called on window resize via the {@link bigshot.ImageBase#onresizeHandler} stub.
872      * @public
873      */
874     onresize : function () {
875         this.resize ();
876         this.layout ();
877     },
878     
879     /**
880      * Returns the current x-coordinate, which is the full-image x coordinate
881      * in the center of the viewport.
882      * @public
883      * @type number
884      */
885     getX : function () {
886         return this.x;
887     },
888     
889     /**
890      * Returns the current y-coordinate, which is the full-image x coordinate
891      * in the center of the viewport.
892      * @public
893      * @type number
894      */
895     getY : function () {
896         return this.y;
897     },
898     
899     /**
900      * Interrupts the current {@link #flyTo}, if one is active.
901      * @public
902      */
903     stopFlying : function () {
904         this.flying++;
905     },
906     
907     /**
908      * Smoothly flies to the specified position.
909      *
910      * @public
911      * @param {number} [x=current x] the new x-coordinate
912      * @param {number} [y=current y] the new y-coordinate
913      * @param {number} [zoom=current zoom] the new zoom level
914      * @param {boolean} [uniformApproach=false] if true, uses the same interpolation curve for x, y and zoom.
915      */
916     flyTo : function (x, y, zoom, uniformApproach) {
917         var that = this;
918         
919         x = x != null ? x : this.x;
920         y = y != null ? y : this.y;
921         zoom = zoom != null ? zoom : this.zoom;
922         uniformApproach = uniformApproach != null ? uniformApproach : false;
923         
924         var startX = this.x;
925         var startY = this.y;
926         var startZoom = this.zoom;
927         
928         var clamped = this.clampXY (x, y);
929         var targetX = this.parameters.wrapX ? x : clamped.x;
930         var targetY = this.parameters.wrapY ? y : clamped.y;
931         var targetZoom = Math.min (this.maxZoom, Math.max (zoom, this.minZoom));
932         
933         this.flying++;
934         var flyingAtStart = this.flying;
935         
936         var t0 = new Date ().getTime ();
937         
938         var approach = function (start, target, dt, step, linear) {
939             var delta = (target - start);
940             
941             var diff = - delta * Math.pow (2, -dt * step);
942             
943             var lin = dt * linear;
944             if (delta < 0) {
945                 diff = Math.max (0, diff - lin);
946             } else {
947                 diff = Math.min (0, diff + lin);
948             }
949             
950             return target + diff;
951         };
952         
953         
954         var iter = function () {
955             if (that.flying == flyingAtStart) {
956                 var dt = (new Date ().getTime () - t0) / 1000;
957                 
958                 var nx = approach (startX, targetX, dt, uniformApproach ? 10 : 4, uniformApproach ? 0.2 : 1.0);
959                 var ny = approach (startY, targetY, dt, uniformApproach ? 10 : 4, uniformApproach ? 0.2 : 1.0);
960                 var nz = approach (startZoom, targetZoom, dt, 10, 0.2);
961                 var done = true;
962                 
963                 var zoomFactor = Math.min (Math.pow (2, that.getZoom ()), 1);
964                 
965                 if (Math.abs (nx - targetX) < (0.5 * zoomFactor)) {
966                     nx = targetX;
967                 } else {
968                     done = false;
969                 }
970                 if (Math.abs (ny - targetY) < (0.5 * zoomFactor)) {
971                     ny = targetY;
972                 } else {
973                     done = false;
974                 }
975                 if (Math.abs (nz - targetZoom) < 0.02) {
976                     nz = targetZoom;
977                 } else {
978                     done = false;
979                 }
980                 that.setPosition (nx, ny, false);
981                 that.setZoom (nz, false);
982                 that.layout ();
983                 if (!done) {
984                     that.browser.requestAnimationFrame (iter, that.container);
985                 }
986             };
987         }
988         this.browser.requestAnimationFrame (iter, this.container);
989     },
990     
991     /**
992      * Returns the maximum zoom level at which a rectangle with the given dimensions
993      * fit into the viewport.
994      *
995      * @public
996      * @param {number} w the width of the rectangle, given in full-image pixels
997      * @param {number} h the height of the rectangle, given in full-image pixels
998      * @type number
999      * @returns the zoom level that will precisely fit the given rectangle
1000      */        
1001     rectVisibleAtZoomLevel : function (w, h) {
1002         return Math.min (
1003             this.fitZoom (w, this.container.clientWidth),
1004             this.fitZoom (h, this.container.clientHeight));
1005     },
1006     
1007     /**
1008      * Returns the base size in screen pixels of the two zoom touch areas.
1009      * The zoom out border will be getTouchAreaBaseSize() pixels wide,
1010      * and the center zoom in hotspot will be 2*getTouchAreaBaseSize() pixels wide
1011      * and tall.
1012      * @deprecated
1013      * @type number
1014      * @public
1015      */
1016     getTouchAreaBaseSize : function () {
1017         var averageSize = ((this.container.clientWidth + this.container.clientHeight) / 2) * 0.2;
1018         return Math.min (averageSize, Math.min (this.container.clientWidth, this.container.clientHeight) / 6);
1019     },
1020     
1021     /**
1022      * Creates a new {@link bigshot.ImageEvent} using the supplied data object,
1023      * transforming the client x- and y-coordinates to local and image coordinates.
1024      * The returned event object will have the {@link bigshot.ImageEvent#localX}, 
1025      * {@link bigshot.ImageEvent#localY}, {@link bigshot.ImageEvent#imageX}, 
1026      * {@link bigshot.ImageEvent#imageY}, {@link bigshot.Event#target} and 
1027      * {@link bigshot.Event#currentTarget} fields set.
1028      *
1029      * @param {Object} data data object with initial values for the event object
1030      * @param {number} data.clientX the clientX of the event
1031      * @param {number} data.clientY the clientY of the event
1032      * @returns the new event object
1033      * @type bigshot.ImageEvent
1034      */
1035     createImageEventData : function (data) {
1036         var elementPos = this.browser.getElementPosition (this.container);
1037         data.localX = data.clientX - elementPos.x;
1038         data.localY = data.clientY - elementPos.y;
1039         
1040         var scale = Math.pow (2, this.zoom);
1041         
1042         data.imageX = (data.localX - this.container.clientWidth / 2) / scale + this.x;
1043         data.imageY = (data.localY - this.container.clientHeight / 2) / scale + this.y;
1044         
1045         data.target = this;
1046         data.currentTarget = this;
1047         
1048         return new bigshot.ImageEvent (data);
1049     },
1050     
1051     /**
1052      * Handles mouse click events. If the touch UI is active,
1053      * we'll pan and/or zoom, as appropriate. If not, we just ignore
1054      * the event.
1055      * @private
1056      */
1057     mouseClick : function (event) {
1058         var eventData = this.createImageEventData ({
1059                 type : "click",
1060                 clientX : event.clientX,
1061                 clientY : event.clientY
1062             });
1063         this.fireEvent ("click", eventData);
1064         /*
1065         if (!eventData.defaultPrevented) {
1066             if (!this.parameters.touchUI) {
1067                 return;
1068             }
1069             if (this.dragged) {
1070                 return;
1071             }
1072             
1073             var zoomOutBorderSize = this.getTouchAreaBaseSize ();
1074             var zoomInHotspotSize = this.getTouchAreaBaseSize ();
1075             
1076             if (Math.abs (clickPos.x) > (this.container.clientWidth / 2 - zoomOutBorderSize) || Math.abs (clickPos.y) > (this.container.clientHeight / 2 - zoomOutBorderSize)) {
1077                 this.flyTo (this.x, this.y, this.zoom - 0.5);
1078             } else {
1079                 var newZoom = this.zoom;
1080                 if (Math.abs (clickPos.x) < zoomInHotspotSize && Math.abs (clickPos.y) < zoomInHotspotSize) {
1081                     newZoom += 0.5;
1082                 }
1083                 var scale = Math.pow (2, this.zoom);
1084                 clickPos.x /= scale;
1085                 clickPos.y /= scale;
1086                 this.flyTo (this.x + clickPos.x, this.y + clickPos.y, newZoom);
1087             }
1088         }
1089         */
1090     },
1091     
1092     /**
1093      * Briefly shows the touch ui zones. See the {@link bigshot.ImageParameters#touchUI}
1094      * documentation for an explanation of the touch ui.
1095      * 
1096      * @public
1097      * @deprecated All common touch gestures are supported by default.
1098      * @see bigshot.ImageParameters#touchUI
1099      * @param {int} [delay] milliseconds before fading out
1100      * @param {int} [fadeOut] milliseconds to fade out the zone overlays in
1101      */
1102     showTouchUI : function (delay, fadeOut) {
1103         if (!delay) {
1104             delay = 2500;
1105         }
1106         if (!fadeOut) {
1107             fadeOut = 1000;
1108         }
1109         
1110         var zoomOutBorderSize = this.getTouchAreaBaseSize ();
1111         var zoomInHotspotSize = this.getTouchAreaBaseSize ();
1112         var centerX = this.container.clientWidth / 2;
1113         var centerY = this.container.clientHeight / 2;
1114         
1115         var frameDiv = document.createElement ("div");
1116         frameDiv.style.position = "absolute";
1117         frameDiv.style.zIndex = "9999";
1118         frameDiv.style.opacity = 0.9;
1119         frameDiv.style.width = this.container.clientWidth + "px";
1120         frameDiv.style.height = this.container.clientHeight + "px";
1121         
1122         var centerSpotAnchor = document.createElement ("div");
1123         centerSpotAnchor.style.position = "absolute";
1124         
1125         var centerSpot = document.createElement ("div");
1126         centerSpot.style.position = "relative";
1127         centerSpot.style.background = "black";
1128         centerSpot.style.textAlign = "center";
1129         centerSpot.style.top = (centerY - zoomInHotspotSize) + "px";
1130         centerSpot.style.left = (centerX - zoomInHotspotSize) + "px";
1131         centerSpot.style.width = (2 * zoomInHotspotSize) + "px";
1132         centerSpot.style.height = (2 * zoomInHotspotSize) + "px";
1133         
1134         frameDiv.appendChild (centerSpotAnchor);
1135         centerSpotAnchor.appendChild (centerSpot);
1136         centerSpot.innerHTML = "<span style='display:inline-box; position:relative; vertical-align:middle; font-size: 20pt; top: 10pt; color:white'>ZOOM IN</span>";
1137         
1138         var zoomOutBorderAnchor = document.createElement ("div");
1139         zoomOutBorderAnchor.style.position = "absolute";
1140         
1141         var zoomOutBorder = document.createElement ("div");
1142         zoomOutBorder.style.position = "relative";
1143         zoomOutBorder.style.border = zoomOutBorderSize + "px solid black";
1144         zoomOutBorder.style.top = "0px";
1145         zoomOutBorder.style.left = "0px";
1146         zoomOutBorder.style.textAlign = "center";
1147         zoomOutBorder.style.width = this.container.clientWidth + "px";
1148         zoomOutBorder.style.height = this.container.clientHeight + "px";
1149         zoomOutBorder.style.MozBoxSizing = 
1150             zoomOutBorder.style.boxSizing = 
1151             zoomOutBorder.style.WebkitBoxSizing = 
1152             "border-box";
1153         
1154         zoomOutBorder.innerHTML = "<span style='position:relative; font-size: 20pt; top: -25pt; color:white'>ZOOM OUT</span>";
1155         
1156         zoomOutBorderAnchor.appendChild (zoomOutBorder);
1157         frameDiv.appendChild (zoomOutBorderAnchor);
1158         
1159         this.container.appendChild (frameDiv);
1160         
1161         var that = this;
1162         var opacity = 0.9;
1163         var fadeOutSteps = fadeOut / 50;
1164         if (fadeOutSteps < 1) {
1165             fadeOutSteps = 1;
1166         }
1167         var iter = function () {
1168             opacity = opacity - (0.9 / fadeOutSteps);
1169             if (opacity < 0.0) {
1170                 that.container.removeChild (frameDiv);
1171             } else {
1172                 frameDiv.style.opacity = opacity;
1173                 setTimeout (iter, 50);
1174             }
1175         };
1176         setTimeout (iter, delay);
1177     },
1178     
1179     /**
1180      * Forces exit from full screen mode, if we're there.
1181      * @public
1182      */
1183     exitFullScreen : function () {
1184         if (this.fullScreenHandler) {
1185             this.removeEventListeners ();
1186             this.fullScreenHandler.close ();
1187             this.addEventListeners ();
1188             this.fullScreenHandler = null;
1189             return;
1190         }
1191     },
1192     
1193     /**
1194      * Maximizes the image to cover the browser viewport.
1195      * The container div is removed from its parent node upon entering 
1196      * full screen mode. When leaving full screen mode, the container
1197      * is appended to its old parent node. To avoid rearranging the
1198      * nodes, wrap the container in an extra div.
1199      *
1200      * <p>For unknown reasons (probably security), browsers will
1201      * not let you open a window that covers the entire screen.
1202      * Even when specifying "fullscreen=yes", all you get is a window
1203      * that has a title bar and only covers the desktop (not any task
1204      * bars or the like). For now, this is the best that I can do,
1205      * but should the situation change I'll update this to be
1206      * full-screen<i>-ier</i>.
1207      * @public
1208      */
1209     fullScreen : function (onClose) {
1210         if (this.fullScreenHandler) {
1211             return;
1212         }
1213         
1214         var message = document.createElement ("div");
1215         message.style.position = "absolute";
1216         message.style.fontSize = "16pt";
1217         message.style.top = "128px";
1218         message.style.width = "100%";
1219         message.style.color = "white";
1220         message.style.padding = "16px";
1221         message.style.zIndex = "9999";
1222         message.style.textAlign = "center";
1223         message.style.opacity = "0.75";
1224         message.innerHTML = "<span style='border-radius: 16px; -moz-border-radius: 16px; padding: 16px; padding-left: 32px; padding-right: 32px; background:black'>Press Esc to exit full screen mode.</span>";
1225         
1226         var that = this;
1227         
1228         this.fullScreenHandler = new bigshot.FullScreen (this.container);
1229         this.fullScreenHandler.restoreSize = true;
1230         
1231         this.fullScreenHandler.addOnResize (function () {
1232                 if (that.fullScreenHandler && that.fullScreenHandler.isFullScreen) {
1233                     that.container.style.width = window.innerWidth + "px";
1234                     that.container.style.height = window.innerHeight + "px";                
1235                 }
1236                 that.onresize ();
1237             });
1238         
1239         this.fullScreenHandler.addOnClose (function () {
1240                 if (message.parentNode) {
1241                     try {
1242                         div.removeChild (message);
1243                     } catch (x) {
1244                     }
1245                 }
1246                 that.fullScreenHandler = null;
1247             });
1248         
1249         if (onClose) {
1250             this.fullScreenHandler.addOnClose (function () {
1251                     onClose ();
1252                 });
1253         }
1254         
1255         this.removeEventListeners ();
1256         this.fullScreenHandler.open ();
1257         this.addEventListeners ();
1258         if (this.fullScreenHandler.getRootElement ()) {
1259             this.fullScreenHandler.getRootElement ().appendChild (message);
1260             
1261             setTimeout (function () {
1262                     var opacity = 0.75;
1263                     var iter = function () {
1264                         opacity -= 0.02;
1265                         if (message.parentNode) {
1266                             if (opacity <= 0) {
1267                                 try {
1268                                     div.removeChild (message);
1269                                 } catch (x) {}
1270                             } else {
1271                                 message.style.opacity = opacity;
1272                                 setTimeout (iter, 20);
1273                             }
1274                         }
1275                     };
1276                     setTimeout (iter, 20);
1277                 }, 3500);
1278         }
1279         
1280         return function () {
1281             that.fullScreenHandler.close ();
1282         };        
1283     },
1284     
1285     /**
1286      * Unregisters event handlers and other page-level hooks. The client need not call this
1287      * method unless bigshot images are created and removed from the page
1288      * dynamically. In that case, this method must be called when the client wishes to
1289      * free the resources allocated by the image. Otherwise the browser will garbage-collect
1290      * all resources automatically.
1291      * @public
1292      */
1293     dispose : function () {
1294         this.browser.unregisterListener (window, "resize", this.onresizeHandler, false);
1295         this.removeEventListeners ();
1296     }
1297 };
1298 
1299 /**
1300  * Fired when the user double-clicks on the image
1301  *
1302  * @name bigshot.ImageBase#dblclick
1303  * @event
1304  * @param {bigshot.ImageEvent} event the event object
1305  */
1306 
1307 /**
1308  * Fired when the user clicks on (but does not drag) the image
1309  *
1310  * @name bigshot.ImageBase#click
1311  * @event
1312  * @param {bigshot.ImageEvent} event the event object
1313  */
1314 
1315 bigshot.Object.extend (bigshot.ImageBase, bigshot.EventDispatcher);
1316
